trans-unit.source: Automating Azure virtual machine deployment with Chef

trans-unit.source: Chef is a great tool for delivering automation and desired state configurations.
trans-unit.target: Chef is a great tool for delivering automation and desired state configurations.

trans-unit.source: With our latest cloud-api release, Chef provides seamless integration with Azure, giving you the ability to provision and deploy configuration states through a single command.
trans-unit.target: With our latest cloud-api release, Chef provides seamless integration with Azure, giving you the ability to provision and deploy configuration states through a single command.

trans-unit.source: In this article, I’ll show you how to set up your Chef environment to provision Azure virtual machines and walk you through creating a policy or “CookBook” and then deploying this cookbook to an Azure virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In this article, I’ll show you how to set up your Chef environment to provision Azure virtual machines and walk you through creating a policy or “CookBook” and then deploying this cookbook to an Azure virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Chef basics
trans-unit.target: Chef basics

trans-unit.source: Before you begin, I suggest you review the basic concepts of Chef.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin, I suggest you review the basic concepts of Chef.

trans-unit.source: There is great material <html></html>here<html></html> and I recommend you have a quick read before you attempt this walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: There is great material <html></html>here<html></html> and I recommend you have a quick read before you attempt this walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: I will however recap the basics before we get started.
trans-unit.target: I will however recap the basics before we get started.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram depicts the high-level Chef architecture.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram depicts the high-level Chef architecture.

trans-unit.source: Chef has three main architectural components: Chef Server, Chef Client (node), and Chef Workstation.
trans-unit.target: Chef has three main architectural components: Chef Server, Chef Client (node), and Chef Workstation.

trans-unit.source: The Chef Server is our management point and there are two options for the Chef Server: a hosted solution or an on-premises solution.
trans-unit.target: The Chef Server is our management point and there are two options for the Chef Server: a hosted solution or an on-premises solution.

trans-unit.source: We will be using a hosted solution.
trans-unit.target: We will be using a hosted solution.

trans-unit.source: The Chef Client (node) is the agent that sits on the servers you are managing.
trans-unit.target: The Chef Client (node) is the agent that sits on the servers you are managing.

trans-unit.source: The Chef Workstation is our admin workstation where we create our policies and execute our management commands.
trans-unit.target: The Chef Workstation is our admin workstation where we create our policies and execute our management commands.

trans-unit.source: We run the knife command from the Chef Workstation to manage our infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: We run the knife command from the Chef Workstation to manage our infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: There is also the concept of “Cookbooks” and “Recipes”.
trans-unit.target: There is also the concept of “Cookbooks” and “Recipes”.

trans-unit.source: These are effectively the policies we define and apply to our servers.
trans-unit.target: These are effectively the policies we define and apply to our servers.
